none: The oldest group of dancers among the women are those who are married, called old virgins, wearing black skirts.; including "Against the Swirl of Time"
Gift of Sonjia Olstad, Lydia Pederson's niece, and her husband, Jim Olstad, 2018-06-14.

Typed correspondence between Pederson and filmmaker Ray Phoenix concerns her obtaining his films of native life (Shembe, Abakhwetha, witch doctors), firewalking, and Egypt (from his trip to East Africa in 1950), and requests for him to obtain lion or other animal films for her. Two untitled, uncredited narration scripts apparently by Phoenix (for the Abakwetha and firewalking films; annotated by Pederson). Phoenix mentions his original script for a Shembe film (this may be the narration entitled "Against the swirl of time", original title "The place of spiritual uplift"). Receipts for films and records. Phoenix' plan to go to Kruger Park to photograph the Dhomba or Python girls' initiation dance; and his hope to tour the United States. Related correspondence between Pederson and African Car Hire regarding a misplaced tripod.
Lydia Luhman Pederson collection--Associated materials, chiefly 1953

The images on this web site, from material in the collections of the Melville J. Herskovits Library of African Studies of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Artifacts and other objects collected during Lydia Pederson's 1953 trip from Capetown, South Africa to Cairo, Egypt, and during Sonjia and Jim Olstad's 1967 stay in Nigeria: primarily beadwork, sculpture, carved calabashes, jewelry, and textiles. The collection includes a small amount of related material.
